      /* * isLessOrEqual - if x <= y  then return 1, else return 0 *   Example: isLessOrEqual(4,5) = 1.*   Legal ops: ! ~ & ^ | + << >>*   Max ops: 24*   Rating: 3*/int isLessOrEqual(int x, int y) {// 0xFFFFFFFF or 0x00000000int difSign = (x^y)>>31;// x is negative and y is positive// then x must be less than y// 0x00000001 or 0x00000000int difSign_NegX = ((difSign&x)>>31)&0x1;// x and y are both positiveint negY = ~y+1;int xSubY = x+negY;int resultSign = (xSubY>>31)&0x1;int isLessOrEqual = (resultSign|!xSubY) & !difSign;return difSign_NegX|isLessOrEqual;}

    /* howManyBits - return the minimum number of bits required to represent x in*             two's complement*  Examples: howManyBits(12) = 5*            howManyBits(298) = 10*            howManyBits(-5) = 4*            howManyBits(0)  = 1*            howManyBits(-1) = 1*            howManyBits(0x80000000) = 32*  Legal ops: ! ~ & ^ | + << >>*  Max ops: 90*  Rating: 4*/int howManyBits(int x) {  int sign = x>>31;  int bit16,bit8,bit4,bit2,bit1,bit0;  x = (sign&~x)|(~sign&x);  bit16 = !!(x>>16)<<4;  x = x>>bit16;  bit8 = !!(x>>8)<<3;  x = x>>bit8;  bit4 = !!(x>>4)<<2;  x = x>>bit4;  bit2 = !!(x>>2)<<1;  x = x>>bit2;  bit1 = !!(x>>1);  x = x>>bit1;  bit0 = x;  return bit16+bit8+bit4+bit2+bit1+bit0+1;}

    /* * floatScale2 - Return bit-level equivalent of expression 2*f for*   floating point argument f.*   Both the argument and result are passed as unsigned int's, but*   they are to be interpreted as the bit-level representation of*   single-precision floating point values.*   When argument is NaN, return argument*   Legal ops: Any integer/unsigned operations incl. ||, &&. also if, while*   Max ops: 30*   Rating: 4*/unsigned floatScale2(unsigned uf) {  int sign = uf>>31<<31;  int exp = uf>>23 & 0xff;  if (exp==255) return uf;  if (exp==0) return sign|uf<<1;  exp++;  if (exp==255) return sign|exp<<23;  return sign|exp<<23|(0x807fffff&uf);}

    /* * floatFloat2Int - Return bit-level equivalent of expression (int) f*   for floating point argument f.*   Argument is passed as unsigned int, but*   it is to be interpreted as the bit-level representation of a*   single-precision floating point value.*   Anything out of range (including NaN and infinity) should return*   0x80000000u.*   Legal ops: Any integer/unsigned operations incl. ||, &&. also if, while*   Max ops: 30*   Rating: 4*/int floatFloat2Int(unsigned uf) {  int sign = uf>>31;  int exp = uf>>23 & 0xFF;  int frac = uf & 0x7FFFFF;  int bias = 127;  int x;  if (exp < bias){      x = 0;  }else if(exp >= 31+bias){      x = 0x80000000;  }else{      int E = exp - bias;      int M = frac | 0x800000;      if (E > 23) {          x = M << (E - 23);      } else {          x = M >> (23 - E);      }  }  return sign ? -x : x;}

    /* * floatPower2 - Return bit-level equivalent of the expression 2.0^x*   (2.0 raised to the power x) for any 32-bit integer x.**   The unsigned value that is returned should have the identical bit*   representation as the single-precision floating-point number 2.0^x.*   If the result is too small to be represented as a denorm, return*   0. If too large, return +INF.* *   Legal ops: Any integer/unsigned operations incl. ||, &&. Also if, while *   Max ops: 30 *   Rating: 4*/unsigned floatPower2(int x) {  int bias = 127;  if(x<-150) return 0;  if(x>127) return 0xff<<23;  if(x<-127) return 0x1<<(150-x);  return (x+bias)<<23;}

package com.qfedu.common.utils;import java.io.File;import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;import java.util.Date;import java.util.UUID;public class FileUtils {    //åˆ›å»ºæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ ä¸€ä¸ªæœˆä¸€ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹    public static File createDir(String dir) {        //å­æ–‡ä»¶åç§° yyyyMM        String month=new SimpleDateFormat("yyyyMM").format(new Date());        File dir1=new File(new File(dir).getParent(),"fmwimages");        File dir2=new File(dir1,month) ;        if(!dir2.exists()) {            dir2.mkdirs();        }        return dir2;    }    //åˆ›å»ºå”¯ä¸€åç§°     public static String createFileName(String fileName) {        if(fileName.length()>30) {            fileName=fileName.substring(fileName.length()-30);        }        return UUID.randomUUID().toString()+"_"+fileName;    }}

package com.qfedu.common.utils;import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;import java.net.Inet4Address;import java.net.UnknownHostException;import java.util.Date;import java.util.Properties;import javax.mail.MessagingException;import javax.mail.Session;import javax.mail.Transport;import javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress;import javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage;import com.qfedu.domain.User;/* * åŸºäºJDKå®ç°é‚®ä»¶å‘é€ * ä¸»è¦æ˜¯å®ç°æ¿€æ´»ç çš„å‘é€ * */public class EmailUtils {    public static void sendEmail(User user){        //é‚®ç®±        String myAccount = "";        //æˆæƒç         String myPass = "";        //é‚®ç®±æœåŠ¡å™¨        String SMTPHost = "smtp.163.com";        //è®¾ç½®å±æ€§ä¿¡æ¯        Properties prop = new Properties();        //è®¾ç½®åè®®        prop.setProperty("mail.transport.protocol", "smtp");        //é‚®ä»¶æœåŠ¡å™¨        prop.setProperty("mail.smtp.host", SMTPHost);        //è®¤è¯        prop.setProperty("mail.smtp.auth", "true");        //1ã€åˆ›å»ºä¼šè¯        Session session = Session.getDefaultInstance(prop);        //è®¾ç½®æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦è°ƒè¯•        session.setDebug(false);        //2ã€åˆ›å»ºå‘é€ä¿¡æ¯        MimeMessage message = createMsg(session,myAccount,user);        //4å‘é€ä¿¡æ¯æ“ä½œ        try {            Transport tran = session.getTransport();            //è¿æ¥            tran.connect(myAccount, myPass);            //å‘é€æ¶ˆæ¯             tran.sendMessage(message, message.getAllRecipients());            //å…³é—­            tran.close();        } catch (MessagingException e) {            // TODO Auto-generated catch block            e.printStackTrace();        }    }    //ç”Ÿæˆé‚®ä»¶æ¶ˆæ¯    private static MimeMessage createMsg(Session session, String myAccount, User user) {        //åˆ›å»ºæ¶ˆæ¯å¯¹è±¡        MimeMessage message = new MimeMessage(session);        //è®¾ç½®        try {            //3.1å‘é€æ–¹            message.setFrom(new InternetAddress(myAccount, "é”‹è¿·ç½‘å®˜æ–¹é‚®ä»¶", "utf-8"));            //3.2è®¾ç½®æ¥æ”¶æ–¹            /*             * MimeMessage.RecipientType.TO              * MimeMessage.RecipientType.CC              * MimeMessage.RecipientType.BCC              * */            message.setRecipient(MimeMessage.RecipientType.TO, new InternetAddress(user.getEmail(), user.getUsername(), "utf-8"));            //3.3 è®¾ç½®ä¸»é¢˜            message.setSubject("é”‹è¿·ç½‘æ¿€æ´»ç ","utf-8");            //è·å–æœ¬æœºçš„ipåœ°å€            String ip = Inet4Address.getLocalHost().getHostAddress();            String url = "http://"+ip+":8086/PhoneNet/activate?e="+ Base64Utils.encode(user.getEmail())+"&c="+Base64Utils.encode(user.getActivatecode());            //è®¾ç½®æ­£æ–‡ä¿¡æ¯            message.setContent(user.getUsername()+",æ¬¢è¿ä½ åŠ å…¥æˆ‘ä»¬<br>ä¸ºäº†æ›´å¥½ä½“éªŒæˆ‘ä»¬çš„äº§å“ï¼Œè¯·<a href='"+url+"'>ç‚¹å‡»æ¿€æ´» "+url+"</a>","text/html;charset=utf-8");            //è®¾ç½®æ—¥æœŸ            message.setSentDate(new Date());            //ä¿å­˜            message.saveChanges();        } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException | MessagingException | UnknownHostException e) {            // TODO Auto-generated catch block            e.printStackTrace();        }        return message;    }}

         try {              InputStream in = Resources.getResourceAsStream(resource);              SqlSessionFactory factory = new SqlSessionFactoryBuilder().build(in);              SqlSession sqlSession = factory.openSession();              StudentMapper mapper;              Student student;              int result;              System.out.println("-----------test @Select-----------");              mapper = sqlSession.getMapper(StudentMapper.class);              } else {                  System.out.println("æ›´æ–°æ“ä½œå¤±è´¥");              }              sqlSession.commit();              System.out.println("-----------test @Delete-----------");       package com.qfedu.pojo;  public class Stu {      private int sid;      private String sname;      private String age;      private String course;      private StuCard sc;      public int getSid() {          return sid;      }      public void setSid(int sid) {          this.sid = sid;      }      public String getSname() {          return sname;      }      public void setSname(String sname) {          this.sname = sname;      }      public String getAge() {          return age;      }      public void setAge(String age) {          this.age = age;      }      public String getCourse() {          return course;      }      public void setCourse(String course) {          this.course = course;      }      public StuCard getSc() {          return sc;      }      public void setSc(StuCard sc) {          this.sc = sc;      }      @Override      public String toString() {          return "Stu [sid=" + sid + ", sname=" + sname + ", age=" + age + ", course=" + course + ", sc=" + sc + "]";      }  }

      package com.qfedu.pojo;  public class Student {      private int sid;      private String name;      private String age;      private String course;      public Student() {}      public Student(int sid, String name, String age, String course) {          super();          this.sid = sid;          this.name = name;          this.age = age;          this.course = course;      }      public int getSid() {          return sid;      }      public void setSid(int sid) {          this.sid = sid;      }      public String getName() {          return name;      }      public void setName(String name) {          this.name = name;      }      public String getAge() {          return age;      }      public void setAge(String age) {          this.age = age;      }      public String getCourse() {          return course;      }      public void setCourse(String course) {          this.course = course;      }      @Override      public String toString() {          return "Student [sid=" + sid + ", name=" + name + ", age=" + age + ", course=" + course + "]";      }  }
